file_content.text: I've taken care of the mercenaries. The Protectors' camps are free.
It looks like that Regulator captain--Captain Nikols--will survive. His wife and son must have thanked us a million times.
When that ark lifts off, you better be there to put Nikols on board. He's not getting any help from us.
I couldn't leave him behind to die. It goes against everything the Jedi believe.
I had no choice.
Right. I forgot what suckers you people are.
Captain Nikols has a family just like you. All he wanted was to save their lives.
Try to see it his way.
No one would have denied his family. All he wanted was to save his own hide.
When the enemy surrenders, we accept. That's what separates us from the Empire.
Sorry, Republic policy.
Well, maybe Makeb doesn't belong in the Republic.
What did you want me to do? Gun the guy down in front of his wife and kid?
Give me a break.
Maybe the kid would have learned something.
He's in Republic custody now. They'll make him answer for his crimes.
You'll still get justice.
He'll get to live. That's already more than he deserved.
If you want that ark to lift off at all, you'll do as I tell you.
I control the ark, not you.
Maybe I'll go down shooting before it does.
Hmph. He wouldn't last long in the Protectors.
Shalim needs someone who will hold his men accountable for their actions.
Keep fighting him.
They may not be Republic yet, but they can act like it.
The closer Makeb comes to destruction, the more desperate people will get.
He's right to worry.
Don't worry. The Protectors don't leave anyone behind.
Keep mouthing off to big men like that, and you won't last long, yourself.
Neither will you.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.
Take it and go. If we have to save every scumbag on this rock, we've got a lot of work ahead.
We've heard. Every man from Maktaba to Frinn is talking about it. You gave that Regulator captain exactly what he deserved.
Tell that to his family. How could you kill him in front of them?
I did what the Regulator threatened to do, himself. No more, no less.
An eye for an eye.
That's the Jedi way?
The Regulator captain had to pay for his crimes, regardless of who was there.
I'm not ashamed.
I suppose you can't help it. What do Jedi know about family?
That Regulator terrorized hundreds of innocent people. He got off easy.
You weren't there.
But he didn't kill any of them!
I've got a rap sheet twice the size of that mercenary's. Still got no regrets.
I've done worse.
There you go. A new recruit.
The Regulators' families should be checked over and seated on the ark. They deserve evacuation like anyone else.
Take care of those people.
We'll take care of them. With no more arguments, I hope.
Those people are as responsible as the Regulators for what happened. If it were up to me, I'd keep them away from the ark.
Leave the families on Makeb.
But it's not. And thank goodness for it.
That's enough now. What's done is done, and I wouldn't have it different. You earned this.
Stay safe out there. You run into any more of Grevin's men, give 'em what they deserve.
Captain Nikols is dead, and the Protectors are rolling again. Couldn't have done better myself.
Clear out, will you? Between holding Captain Nikols and helping the Protectors, you've given me plenty to do.
Every meter you've fought on Makeb is because of the Regulators. Remember that when you get to the Protectors' camps.
Those are families out there. Men, women, children. Your own people! Why are you fighting me on this?
We're the Protectors. Pro-tec-tors. We don't solve problems by slaughtering them!
I'm through arguing. Shalim put me in charge, and if you won't call the Republic for reinforcements, I will.
Hey, wait! You're the Supreme Chancellor's squad, aren't you?
Master Jedi! Can you spare a moment? I need some backup.
You won't do better than Havoc Squad. Major! Over here!
You! You're for hire, right? Not part of this band of butchers?
Please, talk some sense into this man. The bloodshed he's proposing goes against everything the Protectors stand for!
Is there a reason you're ignoring this man's concerns?
I'll fight for you.
Wouldn't you?
With enough patience, any situation can be resolved peacefully.
We can do better.
Hear that? The Jedi agrees with me.
I want to hear the situation--but in combat, sometimes it takes force to get the job done.
Calm down and explain.
Force, yes. Revenge killings, no!
I might just go with the person who's not yelling at me.
Pipe down, buddy.
The captain put me in charge of this mesa. I take that seriously!
I've never heard of your group, and I have no idea what you stand for.
Who are the Protectors?
There are two sides to this story, and so far I've only heard one.
I'll be the judge of that.
It's the only one that matters.
This is Tad Belanger, volunteer with the Protectors. Republic humanitarian group, come to help us get everyone to the ark.
A squad of the Regulators' best attacked the Protectors' evac camps on this mesa. Blew up their defenses, took everyone hostage.
The mercs won't let anyone go unless we promise them seats on the ark. Tad wants to give them first row.
Giving the mercs what they want gets the hostages freed immediately.
It's the safest option.
And no one else gets hurt!
But you think there's a better way to deal with the mercenaries.
And you disagree?
Yeah. Two shots to the head each.
Your own people got killed. How can you not want justice?
That's indefensible.
Our mission is to save lives, not take them.
Those mercs were with the Regulators. They sold us out to the Hutts. They would have left us all behind to die.
They used to be your brothers. Don't they deserve the chance to live?
The Protectors don't control the ark--we do. If you think I'll let that scum on board with my family, think again.
You want Republic aid, you'll follow Republic orders.
You're not in command.
I don't care what Shalim promised. We're not Republic yet, and if this is how you handle criminals....
You can't let those hostages die just so you can punish the mercenaries.
You're being unreasonable.
I don't plan to. I've got a secret weapon now.
If you won't meet their demands, how are you going to free the hostages?
What's the alternative?
I plan to be there when the ark lifts off. I won't let a single merc on board.
I'll back you up on that.
Appreciate the offer, but there's a better way you can help.
Look, the only way to clear out the Regulators is by force. But I've lost three squads to those butchers already.
We send you in, the mercs don't have a chance. Minimum casualties, hostages go free, Protectors get back to business.
What do you think, Tad?
I'm happy to help the Protectors, but only on their terms.
I'm more than willing to try negotiating with these men.
His people, his call. How do you want the mercs handled?
I'm more scared of you than I am of him.
We understand that some force is necessary--we can't let the Regulators take over the ark, after all. All we ask is that you treat the mercenaries with dignity.
Dignity. Right.
Those traitors deserve everything that's coming, and worse.
Sounds like justice.
No one deserves this. I wash my hands of it.
Here are the coordinates. Hit the evac camps first, then the trauma unit. More mercs there than anywhere else.
And I don't care what the Protectors say. These aren't men--they're monsters. Treat them like it.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Sorry, can't help you. Already up to my elbows with the Protectors.
I told our captain what you did for us. He authorized me to give you this, out of our own stockpile.
I've met your people before. You're here to evacuate Makeb's civilians, right?
I know the Protectors.
As peaceful noncombatants. We won't be party to murder!
Being loud and annoying, so far.
I'll be the judge of that.
